adjective.description: Of, characterized by, or suggestive of, hell-fire; fuelled by evil.
As an intensive: terrible, damned. Compare "all-fired [adverb]". Now rare (chiefly US in later use).

adverb.description: As an intensive: very, extremely, damned.

origin: Mid 17th century. From hell-fire + -ed. With use as adverb compare slightly later hell-fire.
